newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela bolivar ends firm at 483.50/484.50/dlr.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela bolivar ends firm at 483.50/484.50/dlr.

text.p: The Venezuelan bolivar closed slightly firmer at 483.50/484.50 per dollar in light trade as investors bought bolivars to take advantage of high interbank lending rates, traders said.
The unit closed Thursday at 483.75/484.75 per dollar.
"The exchange rate firmed because the overnight rate remains high, around 80 percent, and investors are selling dollars to get the bolivars," said one broker.
Trade for the coming weak was seen following a similar pattern with the exchange rate largely stable "as the money market remains tight," said one trader.
Overnight interbank lending rates rose to between 55 and 85 percent from 30 to 70 percent on Thursday, although market participants said they saw lending rates falling over the coming week.
